books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: The story takes place during three years of the Great Depression in the fictional Maycomb, Alabama. This is a place where racism is deeply ingrained in the local culture. The story focuses on young Scout Finch, whose father, Atticus, is a lawyer representing

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: The story takes place in a nightmarish dystopia, in which an ever-surveillant State enforces perfect conformity among citizens through indoctrination, fear, lies and ruthless punishment. The protagonist, Winston Smith, is a worker who secretly hates the Party.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The story takes place in the summer of 1922. Nick Carraway, a Yale graduate and World War I veteran from the Midwest – who serves as the novel's narrator – takes a job in New York as a bond salesman. He rents a small house on Long Island, in the fictional .

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story is a first-person narrative, and is presented in the form of a long flashback. Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, describes events that happened to him the previous Christmas. The story begins with Holden at Pencey Prep School on...

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The story follows Ishmael, a sailor aboard the whaling ship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab. Ahab is obsessed with seeking revenge on Moby Dick, a giant white sperm whale that on a previous voyage destroyed Ahab's ship and severed his leg.

books.title: Two states
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: In a ground-breaking and unputdownable novel, Chetan Bhagat takes you on a journey through two distinct states - one where dreams are born and dashed, and another where resilient individuals fight against a system that has...
